name: Upma
history: Upma, originating from South India, is a popular breakfast dish made from semolina or coarse rice flour. It is known for its ease of preparation and versatility.
description: Upma is a savory porridge-like dish made from semolina, seasoned with spices, and often includes vegetables like carrots, peas, and green beans.

instructions.title: Roast Semolina
instructions.description: Dry roast the semolina in a saucepan until it turns light golden and aromatic. Set aside.

instructions.title: Temper Spices
instructions.description: In the same pan, heat ghee or oil. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Once they splutter, add green chili, ginger, and onion. SautÃ© until the onion turns translucent.

instructions.title: Cook Vegetables
instructions.description: Add diced carrots, peas, and chopped green beans to the pan. SautÃ© for a few minutes. Then add water and salt, bringing it to a boil.

instructions.title: Make Upma
instructions.description: Slowly add the roasted semolina to the boiling water, stirring continuously. Cook until the water is absorbed and the upma is cooked to your desired consistency.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the upma hot, garnished with additional curry leaves or grated coconut if desired.

tips: Stir continuously while adding semolina to prevent lumps.
The consistency of upma can be adjusted by varying the amount of water.
variations: Add roasted nuts for a crunchy texture.
Incorporate other vegetables like bell peppers or tomatoes for different flavors.

storage.shelfLife: Upma can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in a microwave or on the stove with a little water to maintain moisture.
presentationTips: Garnish with fresh coriander and a squeeze of lemon juice for added flavor.
